item.title: Writing a Novel with Visual Studio Code
item.description: If you’re a software developer who also loves to indulge in novel writing, you might be intrigued to discover that you don’t necessarily need a specialised writing tool. Visual Studio Code, the versatile code editor, can prove to be a surprisingly effective ally in your creative writing endeavours. Let’s delve into how Visual Studio Code can enhance your novel-writing experience.

item.title: Installing the NewRelic .NET agent on an Alpine Docker image
item.description: Alpine is a small Linux distribution, commonly used in containers like Docker due to its size.

item.title: An implementation of the Capital Controls kata in Python
item.description: A walkthrough of the Capital Controls Kata in Python. Train of thought and a retrospective.

item.title: Trigger validation of a dropdown box when tabbing over it in KnockoutJS
item.description: When tabbing over a dropdown box in a form, it's tougher to trigger its validations than it is with empty text boxes. Here's a trick on how to enable that.

item.title: The Capital Controls Kata
item.description: A code kata to explore adaptation in changing system requirements.

item.title: Github Pages offers HTTPS for one custom domain. However you can point more than one domain to your pages (with caveats).
item.description: Back in 2018 Github began to offer free dedicated certificates on Github Pages. This was achieved by teaming up with Let’s Encrypt, a certificate authority that provides free SSL/TLS certificates. Before that, if you wanted to serve your site through HTTPS you had to use a service like Cloudflare, point your domain to its name servers and enable HTTPS through its interface.

item.title: Jekyll blog posts in their own sub URL
item.description: When rolling out a new blog, you can put all blog posts under their own sub URL.

item.title: Parallel.Foreach with ordered output using arrays
item.description: One of the problems I've recently had was to process a collection of data and return the outcome of each processing in another collection. To utilise the multiple and/or hyper threaded cores of the machine that executes the processing, I've used the Task Parallel Library.

item.title: Umbraco 6 and ASP.NET Web API
item.description: Umbraco 6.1.0 has introduced support for the ASP .NET Web API. We’ll see what kind of support is currently offered, its shortcomings and how we can improve it.

item.title: NUnit Test method code snippet
item.description: This is if you don’t use Resharper. Suffices to say Resharper’s Live templates are much easier to create and update but Visual Studio code snippets are an alternative option.
